StatementText: 1. Human oversight during implementation in early days
2. Concerns with confidentiality
3. Concerns with patient acceptability

5. False confidence
6. AI could provide alternate perspectives

13. Too much bureaucracy slowing progress
14. Concerns with liability
15. AI could decrease false positives
16. Proactive preventative care
17. Benefits in equitable access
18. AI could free up time for pt care
19. Developing a rigorous privacy and quality assurance framework
20. AI could be misused
21. Helps with generation of ideas can act as a sounding board

23. AI allows access vast information very quickly to help diagnosis
24. Benefits in early distress screening

30. Savings in time, can integrate different information and improve in treatment especially when there is less number of human specialist
31. AI could remove human bias

33. AI could lead to excessive human delegation, assuming that that AI will take care of it!
34. Knowledge repositing for learning and research

data that the AI model is trained on must be good, clean, large and diverse
47. Concerns with attrition of skills in healthcare providers

49. Loss of human connection/interactions
increases digestability/highlighting key points

59. Prediction/prognosis/treatment recommendations
